summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Dallas Environmental Commission will hold a regular meeting on September 11, 2024, at 5:30 p.m. in the Council Briefing Room at Dallas City Hall and via videoconference. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss environmental issues, provide updates, and make decisions regarding ongoing projects and initiatives.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of minutes from the previous meeting (August 14, 2024).
2. Briefing on the EPA Brownfields Revolving Loan Fund (RLF) Supplemental Grant awarded to the City of Dallas.
3. Monthly updates from various subcommittees including Environmental Health, Environmental Justice, and Strategic Partnerships.

**Important Details**:  
The meeting will feature a briefing by the Office of Environmental Quality and Sustainability regarding the newly awarded EPA grant, which is expected to support environmental initiatives in Dallas. Additionally, updates from commissioners will cover district-specific environmental activities and initiatives.

**Action Items**:  
The commission will seek approval of the minutes from the August meeting and will discuss the implications of the EPA grant. Participation from the public is encouraged, with individuals required to register in advance if they wish to speak. The meeting will conclude with an overview of upcoming meetings, including a Parks, Trails, & the Environment Council Committee session scheduled for October 7, 2024.
